analysis: The documents in this cluster all relate to the establishment, modification, or revocation of committees, councils, or boards within the Executive Branch of the United States government. These entities are created to advise the President or other government officials on specific issues, coordinate activities between different agencies, or implement certain policies. The documents outline the composition, functions, and responsibilities of these entities, as well as their relationship to other government departments and agencies.
title: Executive Branch Committees and Advisory Councils
